intro: Spergularia branlyi, commonly known as the branly's sandspurry, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, fleshy leaves and clustered pink or red flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Spergularia branlyi plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
